Mr. GREEN of Texas. Mr. Speaker, permit me to commend the gentlewoman  for her very moving and powerful commentary. With her consent and  permission, I would…
Mr. GREEN of Texas. Mr. Speaker, I was unable to attend the vote  series today. Had I been present, I would have voted NAY on Roll Call  No. 265 and YEA on Roll Call No. 266.

Mr. GREEN of Texas. Mr. Speaker, and still I rise.

Mr. Speaker, I rise today with a very special message--an admonition,  a prewarning--for the most powerful man in the universe, I am told,…
Mr. GREEN of Texas. Madam Speaker, I was unable to attend the last  three votes of the vote series today. Had I been present, I would have  voted: NAY on Roll Call No. 153, YEA on Roll Call…

Mr. GREEN of Texas. Mr. Speaker, and still I rise, a proud, liberated  Democrat, unbought, unbossed, and unafraid.

Mr. Speaker, I rise today because I believe in the Pledge of  Allegiance.…
Mr. GREEN of Texas. Mr. Speaker, I rise to explain why new moms  cannot proxy vote. The issue is very simple, and the answer is even  simpler to understand. It is because men don't have children.…
Mr. GREEN of Texas. Mr. Speaker, and still I rise now, as I did  during the Joint Address to Congress when I told the President and the  Nation that there is no mandate to cut Medicaid. The…

Mr. GREEN of Texas. Mr. Speaker, proudly I stand here today proudly  to say: And still I rise.

And still I rise, a proud, liberated Democrat, unbought, unbossed,  and still unafraid. And…

Mr. GREEN of Texas. Mr. Speaker, and still I rise, unbought,  unbossed, and unafraid.

Mr. Speaker, I rise, driven by conscience, to embrace the moral  imperative to speak truth not only…
Mr. GREEN of Texas. Mr. Speaker, and still I rise. Still I rise with  my cane in hand. So feared, this cane, by many of my colleagues across  the aisle. It is feared to the extent that they…

Mr. GREEN of Texas. Still I rise, Mr. Speaker, in mourning for the  lives that have been lost at the hands and the color of law.

Mr. Speaker, Mr. Pretti and Ms. Good should not have lost…
Mr. GREEN of Texas. Mr. Speaker, tonight, I voted against sending  more military aid to Israel. I voted against it because I saw it as I  currently see it, as a vote against collective punishment,…
Mr. GREEN of Texas. Mr. Speaker, and still I rise. Mr. Speaker, and  still I  rise, proud to be an American, proud of what this country stands for. I  also rise as a person who is censured.…
Mr. GREEN of Texas. Mr. Speaker, and still I rise. I rise to call to  my colleagues' attention that they are no longer claiming that this is  a clean CR. The truth is that it is a dirty,…

Mr. GREEN of Texas. Mr. Speaker, and still I rise.

Mr. Speaker, I thank Chairman Hill; the gentleman from Ohio (Mr.  Davidson); and the ranking member for allowing me to carry and present…

Mrs. KIM. Mr. Speaker, I thank Chairwoman Wagner for yielding and  supporting my legislation. I would also like to thank Representative  Green of Texas for co-leading H.R. 910 and making this a bipartisan  effort.

Mr. Speaker, I rise in strong support of my bill, H.R. 910, the  Taiwan Non-Discrimination Act.

This bill…

…rise to give notice of my intention to raise a question of the  privileges of the House.

The form of the resolution is as follows:

Resolution Censuring Representative Al Green of Texas.
